node.title: Fringe Test quick's Ashes stocks rise in WA's Sheffield Shield victory
node.alt: A Western Australian fast bowler raises his right hand as he celebrates a Sheffield Shield wicket against Queensland.
node.description: Jhye Richardson may be the next in line if one of Australia's fast bowlers falters in the men's Ashes, after his eight-wicket haul helps propel Western Australia to a comfortable win over Queensland.
node.content:
["Western Australia has cruised to victory over Queensland in their Sheffield Shield match at the Gabba on the back of an eight-wicket match haul from fringe Test quick Jhye Richardson.", "The 25-year-old picked up the Bulls' final scalp early on Saturday to finish with 5-23 from 22.2 overs in the home side's second innings\u00a0before Western Australia\u00a0ran down the 95-run target with seven wickets to spare.", "Richardson \u2014\u00a0who made his Test debut in Brisbane two years ago \u2014\u00a0now has 16 wickets from three Shield Shield matches this season at an average of 12.50.", "While Australia's top three quicks are essentially locked in for the men's Ashes opener at the Gabba next month, competition is fierce among the likes of Richardson, Michael Neser, Mark Steketee, Scott Boland and Sean Abbott to be next cab off the rank.", "Richardson also chipped in with a handy 38 in Western Australia's first innings and recently posted\u00a0a Sheffield Shield half-century.", "\"He bowled beautifully this game. He's got excellent skills,\" Queensland captain Usman Khawaja told cricket.com.au.", "\"I'm a big Jhye Richardson fan, he's been doing it for a long period of time and it's nice to see him fit and healthy.\"", "The Bulls added just two runs to their overnight score of 9-244, with Richardson removing Neser (5), who was caught behind.", "Neser did not bowl after tweaking his hamstring early in the match.", "Former Test opener Cameron Bancroft guided Western Australia home with an unbeaten 47 alongside Josh Philippe (17 not out), who had hit a first-innings century.", "Bowling 10\u00a0overs of medium pace, Marnus Labuschagne removed Western Australia's talented Test all-rounder Cameron Green (15), who left a ball that careered into the stumps.", "Labuschagne had Bancroft dropped twice, while Steketee (2-21) did his best, backing up his four first-innings scalps.", "Richardson picked up the big wickets of Joe Burns (49) and Labuschagne (36) on Friday, shouldering a greater workload in the absence of fellow fast bowler\u00a0Joel Paris, who injured his hamstring on day one.", "
Tasmania, South Australia draw
", "Tasmania and South Australia have settled for a Sheffield Shield draw after rain again hampered proceedings on the final day at Bellerive Oval.", "Play was called off on Saturday afternoon with the Redbacks 0-32 in their second innings, trailing by 30 runs.", "A result seemed long odds in any case, after showers wiped out most of day one and much of the play on Friday afternoon.", "After an eye-catching 134 in South Australia's first innings, young opener Henry Hunt navigated the new ball to finish unbeaten on 15.", "The 24-year-old put his name forward as a men's Ashes squad bolter on day two with the gritty century,\u00a0his second of the season and fifth from 20 first-class matches.", "Resuming at 8-220,\u00a0 the Tigers were bowled out for 282 after an hour of play on day four, with Jordan Silk the last batter out for 58.", "He shared an 86-run stand with Peter Siddle (30), before\u00a0the evergreen veteran was out stumped off the part-time spin of South Australia captain\u00a0Travis Head (2-22), who missed out with 14 in his side's first innings of 220.", "South Australia\u00a0quicks Daniel Worrall (2-55), Nathan McAndrew (2-50) and Liam Scott (2-31) picked up two wickets each.", "AAP/ABC"]
